Ratings.comment: very hands off, everything we learn is from online premade guides. The TA was good, the professor might as well have not existed. good luck, useless 4 page papers ever 2 weeks, with heavy labs and heavy readings. class was horrendous and hard and also learned nothing
Very kind professor. Workload is meh, it's can be lighter or heavier in certain weeks.

Becky is a passionate instructor, but as mentioned earlier, achieving a perfect score on assignments is impossible. She sticks with a single grade and applies it consistently throughout the semester. The material is engaging, and it's a relief not to have quizzes or tests, but her tough grading compensates for the absence of exams.

I took GEO 3801: Political Ecology. If you are not a geography major do not take her class for a GE. She is a really harsh grader and would constantly leave vague comments on what needed improved. never gave our 100%, always took off .5 of points. she wont like you if you arent into geography

Becky is amazing and GEO3801 is so interesting. No tests or quizzes, but there are discussion posts twice a week and optional attendance. There are also one page write ups due twice a month. What makes the course difficult is that some of the readings and academic journals are long and take time to comprehend. Easy B+, Hard A. Final is a project.

There are no tests or quizzes: instead, there are homework assignments mostly consisting of readings and short-to-medium write-ups. Attendance is extra credit. Prof. Mansfield is awesome, very passionate about what she does and what she teaches, flexible, and accessible outside of class. Not the easiest but definitely recommended for this GE.
Her classes are all discussion based, she doesn't like quizzes or exams so it's mostly analyzing readings. She is very laid back about late assignments as long as you communicate with her often.

Very decent professor. I enjoyed her classes when I did go but because attendance was extra credit/small part of grade I think many people skipped the class. The lectures were interesting and she is definitely enthusiastic about what she teaches, and I think your grade reflects the work you put in. Class is very discussion and reading based.
Probably the most intellectually exciting class I took at OSU even though it wasn't super hard

She is a very kind lady and a good professor, however her grading on quizzes is horrible. Very picky on responses no matter what the question is asking. One question asked about your thought on a topic and she only have half a point cause she didn't think the response was thoughtful enough.

Becky is incredible. She has a real interest in this topic and thoroughly enjoys teaching the students about the subject matter and getting them involved in discussions. Random activities for points but participation is not mandatory. Very relaxed and helpful.
Becky is a great professor! She's clear, helpful and seems to really care for the students. Class is easy and interesting. I definitely recommend this class!

Becky is great! I had her for 430 and 635. She is very passionate, approachable, and makes her classes incredibly enjoyable. She is a great resource and is always willing to talk with students. One of my favorites!

I was ill most of the quarter and she seemed pretty reasonable about participation grades. A large part of your grade is just being, mostly from pop quizzes. I averaged a B- on the midterm and final and I missed quite a lot of classes, though I did most of the readings. If you go to class and do the readings, this class will be easy.
very interesting material. communicated clearly-tied together well with course themes. very helpful. great teacher.

She was a decent teacher overall. The course material wasn't very interesting. A large part of you grade is based on being there every day. There are random pop quizzes, which can be annoying. If you are the type of person who never misses a class, this is the class for you. If you miss a class occasionally, you might not want to take it.
She was not very helpful in assisting me during a time of personal difficulty.  Her class was pretty basic and boring for a 400 level class.
Enjoyed the class
Great teacher.  Great interest in the students.  Really cares about the subject matter.  A rare find at OSU.
The course wasn't too hard for upperlevel.  If you show up youll do fine.  Dr. Mansfield is trys hard to be helpful and is a decent teacher.

"you've raised some excellent points, your sentences are clear, and I like what you've shown in your thesis.  you spent a lot of time proving your point and did so very well even though you took a difficult stance.  great job"  B+
Spent more time trying to control the class than teaching.  Way too wet behind the ears to be teaching an upper-level class.

Dr. Fro is not a good professor. Her class is unorganized, and the tests are to see if you show up in class not if you know the content. To do well on the  group projects rely on if you have good partners otherwise you're stuck doing all the work. Be ready to read and study a lot. If you have taken other similar classes the class might be easier.
It was the worst class I've taken at OSU. It was highly unorganized, and the grading criteria weren't clear. Additionally, the professor was unapproachable.

Dr. Fro was so knowledgeable and emphasized class discussion. Kind of a tough grader, but most of the quizzes or the final were short answer. I didn't read a single reading assignment but I attended every lecture and still got an A. Take notes and review, know how to write essays, and lean on your groupmates for the midterm; you'll do fine.

Dr. Hice-Fromille is great. This class was a bit unorganized but she was happy to answer questions/ respond to emails. Make use of office hours (participation points) and ask questions!! Classmates did poorly because they didn't read readings or study for short answer style exams. She emphasizes understanding concepts, not memorization.

Spent more time trying to control the class than teaching.  Way too wet behind the ears to be teaching an upper-level class.

Professor Parece actually has no idea what it's like to be a student in her class. My experience has been upsetting to say the least. Actual absurd amounts of work for a class I'm never going to use, and directions that lack actual helpful and useful directions. I respect professors that want their students to learn, but I feel she doesn't care.

Professor Parece's teaching is ineffective and inconsiderate. She fails to explain concepts clearly in lab directions, leaving students confused and frustrated. Her workload is unreasonable, especially for those taking this class as a requirement. Instead of making the material accessible, she makes the course far more difficult than necessary.

Overall I would say this class went pretty well. For being an intro class for using GIS it was pretty friendly to those without experience on it. Tests were based on lectures and there weren't any textbooks required. Although it could be hard to grasp some of the concepts taught, Dr Parece had quite a few office hours to attend to answer questions.
this class will have you tearing your eyes out with frustration, sooo sooo poorly managed and designed

As long you come into the class knowing that you will learn everything on your own you will do fine. Her lectures are bad and she is very hands off. The textbook sucks and is super expensive. Also you will have to read literally every page of it. However, she is approachable in office hours and over email, and is responsive when prompted

200 dollar(not kidding)required textbook that is vague and outdated (she has "updated" it by writing in edits with mismatched page numbers on carmen). This class desperately needs a TA and dozens of office hours a week. Just very poorly designed class, she seems nice, but you will literally flounder for hours just trying to get ArcGIS to run

When dealing with a complex program like GIS, nothing says "I could care less" like 1 class a week, years old prerecorded lectures, and a hands-off "figure it out" approach where your only true mechanism of consistent help is to keep hounding T.A's or posting in a discussion Q&A and awaiting a response. Lame, lazy, and a class that truly sucked.

Aside from the non-mandatory 8AM lectures, I enjoyed this intro course to map design and GIS. Labs were all useful and applicable, especially once you got to choose your own topics instead of following step-by-step directions. She is a passionate and enthusiastic professor who is ready to help whoever asks for it. TAs are helpful as well.

Dr. Parece is clearly passionate and enthusiastic about GIS. This comes across in her videos. TAs were helpful when need be, but the lab book we worked out of was clear enough that I never really needed to go in person to the labs. Pretty much everyone who takes the course is required to take it for a major/minor, and the class is good enough.
Good lectures, communicates information clearly

Dr Parece seems nice and knowledgeable, but I just didn't gain anything from the class. Her prerecorded lectures were all just her reading off the slides, and then the weekly quizzes would involve questions that were never mentioned. The labs all came from a textbook/workbook that was poorly written, and difficult to follow. Had to teach myself.

Even though this was an intro class, Dr. Parece brought so much enthusiasm to her lectures. You can tell she really likes to teach, and she is very knowledgeable as well. She is very willing to help students, and responds quickly to emails. Deadlines for labs were very manageable. Labs are pretty straightforward, exams are a breeze if you study.
Half-semester long class, very easy and fun. I enjoyed having Professor Parece and her lectures are fairly entertaining.
Dr. Parece has a good layout for GEOG 2200 that makes the class easy to follow. It was well structured and never too much work at once.

A good intro mapping class that fulfills data analysis GE. Professor is new but very kind and knowledgable on the programming you use for assignments. Homework is more or less weekly, a mapping assignment that guides you through the steps and you write a report at the end. Final project, no exams.

Dr. EMT is one of the coolest professors I've ever had. Go google her if you don't know her work. The class had a lot of presentations and group projects but she is a very easy grader. Also start writing the final paper early; it's not that long but she stacked a lot of assignments toward the end of the semester.

Nice woman, passionate about her subject area. I took this class thinking there would be more of a geography and human impact focus, but it turned out being much more atmospheric sciences-focused. It still turned out interesting enough, though some lectures were a little boring. Grading isn't difficult and projects can be interesting.

Dr. EMT is a great professor. She is very knowledgable and one of the most respected people in her field. I learned a lot and really valued her input. If anyone ever had a question, she would make sure to have it answered by the next class if she didn't know the answer. The class is hard, quizzes very hard, and you will stress out all semester.

It's an interesting topic, and EMT is willing to help.  That said, she did not divide the workload fairly between debate groups and didn't seem to realize we had other classes. She doesn't grade the busywork THAT easily, either. It's not a bad honors science option, and the field trip to Byrd Polar is cool. I liked the interdisciplinary approach.

Great professor and class. Didn't care about the topic at all beforehand and ended up being one of my favorite courses. No exams, but there are quizzes and a few group projects. Pretty easy grader, but make sure to study for the quizzes. Field trip to Byrd Polar was so much fun! Take this class if you can, Prof. Thompson is awesome!

Loved debates and trip to the Byrd Polar Research Center.  Whenever students raised questions in class she didn't know the answers to, she ALWAYS started the next class with the answers to these questions. She is a worldwide expert in her field, yet is SO sincere and humble, and loves to learn from her students. Very impressive prof; great class.
Dr. EMT is a sweetheart and very knowledgeable, but her class is a lot of work. Expect to be stressing out all semester long if you take this class.

Having someone who actually works in the field - the field being Antarctica - makes the subject much more interesting and relevant. There was more work than I expected but it was all easy and related to modern issues, forcing us to understand them. I've never taken a course with a professor who truly tries to make you a better all around person.

There seemed to be a ton of assignments but she grades very easy. It would be worse if she graded hard but it's still a lot of work and that was a pain. She's very nice and is interested in her students and the topic but sometimes classes got off track and she seems a little disorganized.

Thankfully, she's a very easy grader for a bunch of behemoth work. She tries to organize things using a daily schedule for class, but somehow still comes across as confusing and scattered. Lectures are bipolarly paced, and she doesn't always emphasize what she thinks is important. Kyung-In is an amazing TA, however.

Best Class!! I agree with everyone else, you will learn so much and it will change your perspective on everything.  If you're looking for a class that'll make you think but there's no useless busywork take this one!!

Amazing class. Good amount of work, but its all very interesting and relevant.  Lots of group work makes for some easy grades.  The topic is very interesting, she really cares about the students and the subject matter and if you can take a class from her you will love yourself.  Not hard to do well either.

Best class I've taken at OSU. When you have a professor who actually cares about the subject AND the students, you can't go wrong. It's a lot of work, but if you put forth the effort, you'll do well. Ask questions, go to office hours, and READ. Take this class, and you'll learn a lot. Should be a required class. You won't regret it.
Dr EMT was a great professor

This class was mostly just discussion posts and quizzes for each module with the final project being a teaching demo. Rawson is willing to help if you reach out and does not penalize turning in assignments late. However, some of the discussion posts were really long and took forever. As long as you keep up with the assignments, you will be fine.
The type of teacher to give homework over breaks
Too many group projects/activities, she just reads off the powerpoint presentation

She's very nice and easy to reach outside of the class. She's also very easy to talk to about extensions and grading. The attendance was written response questions every class. The class had a semester long group project, requiring you to use the bus to travel Columbus. Not my favorite, and the class wasn't very interesting, but she wasn't horrible

She reads off her slides and never elaborates on information she can't use Carmen correctly and when in the midst of crazy finals and our finals weren't submitting correctly she was nowhere to be found. The worst part was that she made us do 12 weeks of research just for us to write a paper that only needed 2-3 sources per person. don't take it!!

This class was a little tricky to get the hang of at first, but once you get a feel for things the material is actually quite interesting. Rawson is super helpful if you reach out, & is very willing to assist you if you need help with an assignment or help reviewing exam materials. She'll give you all the materials & information you need to succeed

Lots of bus work, the class sh*t on capitalism the whole time. Very one sided and failed to blame rich for poors problems. As a conservative I had to keep my mouth shut to get the A. Massive project at end of year. Teacher very clear and gives good feedback if you ask her with interest.
Lectures & notes are pretty helpful. Heavier assignments like exams/projects/HW can be rough though

NOT A BEGINNER CODING CLASS, do not take 5222 if you do not know how to code. this class is brutally unforgiving and very very difficult. Long and numerous projects, 3 timed midterms i never finished, a final project, timed final exam, final homework(another project), and 2 final assigment all due within 3 days of each other. I grinded and got a C

He spends about 6 weeks teaching coding fundamentals, then expects you to apply and understand those fundamentals at a high level AND go "beyond" by creating your own projects/solutions. Definitely a brutal class if you don't know how to code. projects would take me 20+ hours of pain, and there are 4 as well as assigments every week regardless

If you have coded extensively before, this class will be a nice review with lots of interesting GIS applications to coding topics explained. If you have not coded extensively before you will drown and the class is an insane amount of work. Xiao is friendly, but the class is built for CS majors who switched into GIS. Good luck

Dr. Xiao is funny and gives you every opportunity to succeed. Lectures walk you through most of what you need to know to complete homework. Pay attention, be resourceful outside of class by looking for online sources of coding insights in Python, go to him right away if you hit a snag and you will do fine.

Dr Xiao is a very skilled GIScientist. Sometimes, I think he forgets that undergrads aren't on his level. But he's super accessible and helpful outside of class for lab work. Great sense of humor in lectures. Moves very fast through material. Best to look at things ahead of class and come with questions ready because he won't slow down for long

If you don't have programming experience this is not the course for you. He makes a lot of mistakes in lecture but is not clear how to fix the mistakes. He'll teach you real basic concepts but then ask you to do advanced things without giving you all the tools. He takes advantage of the fact that many CSE majors change to GIS .

I took it this semester and I'm probably going to end up with an A in it, but I learned absolutely nothing. I knew nothing about GIS before the class, and I know nothing about it now. The material was relatively easy to learn, but nothing made sense and I didn't understand anything in any of his lectures. I only went to lecture to get points.

Professor Xiao's class was the best I've taken so far. He makes the material easy to understand and entertains with his understated sense of humor. His comprehensive study guides make tests easy if you study. The labs can be pretty hard but if you go to office hours, he's extremely helpful. Would recommend for anyone interested in GIS.

Explains class material pretty well. Missing in-class assignments brought my grade down from an A to B+ but the material was easy enough that I didn't need lecture or the book to understand it, the slides alone were enough. Labs were easy. Final project is fun as you get to make your own map on GIS, but Dr. Xiao grades this pretty tough.

This professor appeared to be harsh and strict but internally a very nice person. He may be the best, if not only, person in the dept you should go to if you have any questions about GIS. He offers a useful and also A booster class for those who have some experience in GIS and know a little programming.
When I took his intermediate GIS class, I learned a great deal.  Ninchuan makes class fun, and even with his strong accent, he speaks well. You can easily tell that he knows a lot about GIS.

Maybe the class became easier this quarter, but this class wasn't hard in any way. The content of the class was definitely boring, but in no way hard. 3 Exams, 8 easy Labs, 1 Map Project (which was really fun).
lots of work
dr. xiao takes alot of****. his classes are generally boring... but overall hes really not a bad guy, if you go into his office once he'll favor you
I wanted to kill myself EVERY second of this class.  It was the hardest class I've ever taken and he truly has NO MERCY.  Do not take this class and save yourself from the stress!!!!!!!

Dr Dutta has been my best professor in 4 years at OSU, and I'm not even a Geog major. 5501 was great, based on discussing readings and films, a group project, and community walks. It was super laid back so if you do the work you'd do well. Dr. Dutta is so kind and inspiring and passionate, I wish I could take more courses with her!

Dr. Dutta has been my most impactful professor during my time at OSU. Not even a Geography major, took 5501 on a recommendation. 5501 was great, mostly built around discussing readings & films, & community walks too. I learned so much and loved the laid back structure, and Dr. Dutta is so inspiring and supportive! Do the work, & you'll do well!

Took 2400.02. Professor is very understanding of out-of-class circumstances and is willing to work with students. Weekly quizzes on videos/podcasts that can be over an hour long. Very lenient exam grader. The final group research project was a lot of work during the last couple weeks, but nothing overly tedious.

Prof Dutta was very good and her TAs were very helpful. She genuinely wants her students to do well, but with it being online if you didn't understand the material you almost NEEDED to go to office hours. Overall she was great. Only thing I will say is the second midterm and the final were about a week apart, felt a little rushed on that end.

This course is not hard and the professor and ta were very understanding and helpful. The final group project was annoying but was graded on what was individually done by each member so it was not difficult to get a good grade. The exams are open book essay questions that were open all day and just ask you just to draw from lecture to answer them.

This class was okay but the work was a little excessive. Two midterms with a final group project AND final 5 page essay. Not to mention that the group project, the second midterm, and the final were all due in the last three weeks. Could just be me but I don't know that seems to be a little overkill.

She is one of the coolest professors I have had at OSU! Her and her TAs are extremely easygoing and care about you learning the content. As long as you watch the lectures, the midterms are a slice of cake. Reading and films are also pretty interesting. The final project can be a lot but time manage with your group! She is awesome--would take again.

Favorite class so far at OSU! Most assignments are essays graded based on integrating ideas from the lectures and the readings, which is a great way to test knowledge! However, some lectures felt unorganized and the final is weighted too much (50% of class grade). Just read the readings and participate in class and it's easy and fun! Field trips!

Madhumita is awesome. Her lectures can be scattered, but she's very passionate and experienced, absolutely worth your time. Her class was loosely organized and discussion-based, an easy A but a hard A+. Come into her class with an open mind.
great course, I learned so much and the professor goes above and beyond to integrate what we learn in class with real-world problems. I would recommend this course and any others that she teaches!

attendance is 10% of the score, class participation is 10% and or other 80% is based on the midterms and final, exams are open books open internet short essay questions, there is no correct answer, you should be creative and reliable. seldom lecture nots post on canvas, listen to the professor carefully!

I need to make this clear, this professor has CHANGED, not the same one that people have raved about. In an effort to crack down on cheating, he's made the tests 60% of your total grade and they're HARD, paper and pencil. If you can get out of taking a class with him, DO IT. His new policies are hurting everyones grades, he's been my only C at OSU

Dr. Quiring is a great professor! While lectures can be dull from time to time, he does well making the content applicable through assignments. He wants everyone to succeed and is more than willing to help outside of class when needed. Exams are nearly identical to assignments & content. Would strongly recommend him!
Dr. Quiring is great to work with!

Dr. Quiring is a great professor. He wants everyone in the class to succeed and is there to help every step of the way. He made the material interesting and fun. His exams were straight forward. I would recommend him to anyone.

Dr. Quiring was a really good prof. He gives interesting lectures and really cares about the success of his students. Yes the class involves a decent amount of work, but its a class where you learn so much. I would recommend this class to anyone.

The first half of the semester was great (just assignments and a midterm), but after spring break we had to read 120+ pages of scientific papers a week, present on one, write a 12 page final paper, AND have a final exam. Overall, he was great but it was very work heavy for his first semester teaching it. Just make sure not to fall behind.

She's lecture is so boring. The readings she assigned each week were very difficult to understand and took too much time. You need to write an essay every week, and the word requirement for the paper goes from 500 words to vague (you need to write more to get points). The grading of essays is very harsh and the class average is very low.

Professor Ettlinger is one of the most inconsistent graders I've had. She does give a lot of feedback, but often if she doesn't like the comparison you are trying to give she will take points off. Homework is for completion and you will be graded on papers and projects that follow the backward grading strategy listed above. Would NOT recommend her.

I've never had a professor give more vague assignments and then grade so harshly, it's like she assumed we could all read her mind. Her class was repetitive, called for about 80-100 pages of reading a week, and was overall confusing. I'd highly recommend skipping this one.

Basically, you go in and the first day she'll tell you READ! And you will pass, but show up to lecture.... lecture was literally the most boring thing ever shes just goes on and on and doesnt stop. She will volunteer people to speak and then counter what they say in every way possible then continues on to the next thing. Lecture was a waste of time
Long lectures, boring subject matter, but she's very passionate about it. Grade determined by midterms and final.

Grade based off 2 Carmen posts (guaranteed A if you just do it&make it relevant, super easy) &2 exams--not hard, very fair. Hands out very helpful outlines--study those. ATTENDANCE IS IMPORTANT can potentially bump your end of semester grade up. Extra credit available, extensive reading assignments--didn't do them, just took notes in lecture

Very. Very. Boring. Assigns unreasonable academic essays for readings. Tests are over class outlines. In the middle of the semester, she passed out handouts for her students to give her recommendations. I recommended that she shorten the readings and make the class less political. Regarding the readings, her response was and I quote: "Get over it."

Lots of reading. Im only here to tell you that you cannot pass her class unless you agree with her solutions to social issues (bernie). You must be an indoctrinated socialist leftist to move on. Do you think capitalism is a good idea? Do you think people are personally responsible? Well, get ready to fail. You have to agree with her to pass.

Lectures are neither boring nor interesting, varies with the material being discussed and one's interest. The first exam is very fair, outlines given in class should be highly beneficial and mostly all that one needs for the exam. The second exam is similar except the material is not covered as well in the outlines and more difficult to study for.

You have to read around 30-50 pages worth of material each week. She also only focuses on the geography part of the subject, criticizing economics all the time. Her class is extremely boring and she grades very harshly.

Professor Ettlinger was a terrible professor. Says the class was not about memorization, but her exams were almost exactly that. The readings were unrealistically long and she expected you to fully understand the 50 page article and be able to discuss it in class. Exams were absolutely impossible. Avoid at all costs.

Worst class I've taken. Be prepared to read unreasonable amounts of reading each week. DO NOT TAKE HER. Nothing about it is enjoyable. And if you don't have prior knowledge of material you are completely left behind. Her lectures are just her talking. She skips around a lot so it's impossible to take notes. Please stay away from her if you can.

I have taken three classes with Nancy and she is wonderful. She has high expectations--- you will read and write ALOT, but you will be challenged, develop strong critical thinking skills, and come away with a thorough understanding of debates in the discipline. Plus she is always in her office and willing to help students in anyway possible

Be prepared to work. This course was challenging (probably the most difficult I have had at OSU) but also extremely rewarding. She does have high expectations for knowledge coming into the class, and there are usually 50ish pages of fairly difficult journal articles per class. If you go to her office hours she is very helpful.

she says this class assumes you have no pre-reqs. she's wrong. if she's teaching this class then you need an extensive background in a lot of social theory and feminism or you're going to be lost. The exam essays also have unreasonable expectations and are too long-she apparently forgets that students take more than one class. stay away.
Professor Ettlinger is very patient and loving, which reminds me of my own mother. I like her. And the course is interesting if you are interested in economics.

This is the worst class I have ever taken at Ohio State. The material is awfully dry, and I could barely keep my eyes open during her lecture. She just talks the whole time about her opinions. Beware!!!

Dr. Ettlinger is a brilliant professor. Smart, insightful, opinionated (but not in an overbearing way). Participate in class discussions and pay attention to the videos shown in class and you will do fine. The material can be challenging at times, but if you show up, pay attention and have decent critical thinking skills you will do fine.

Dr. Ettlinger is very much willing to help understand, she goes over things however many times it takes to get the point across. She assigned a book that really is very neutral and when she lectures she chooses to omit the parts that dont agree with her. During in class discussion I would swear I had read different books and seen different movies
This class is so boring I wanted to cry. Bring a book or laptop or something to do. Assigns long, boring readings over obscure things. Tests draw heavily on the readings.

She tries to liven up the class with her opinions on things, which can be great sometimes and not so great at other times, but either way it is better then falling asleep. We seemed to watch a lot of movies. There were quite a few articles but not as much reading as I've done in other Geog. classes. Tests are easy. Show up you'll do well.
She assigns an unreasonable amount of reading.  The class is interesting at times.
No Comments

She was very willing to help me work around a personal situation, and we discussed a great deal of subject matter out of class.  The damn readings were a pain!  She should hire a student to type them out instead of using photocopied articles.  Nancy, build a website!
this was one of the best class that I took. Nancy is brilliant. The readings are great and the teacher leads the discussions very well. Keep it up!

One should rename this class "Nancy's Tirade on Capitalism".  She would give you two opposing articles than absolutely trash the one that believed in Western Economics.  There was no scientific data to back her ranting.  I learned NOTHING except for her opinion.  At one point she blamed those who looked like me (blonde) for terrorism.
Unless you want to work really hard and learn a ton, don't take this class.
No Comments

Course load is pretty substantial, and lectures/discussions can be hard to follow, but she's always willing to listen & actually likes it when you disagree with her. Exams are awful, though--take-home essays that demand 10+ pages per question.

Mat is funny, engaging, witty, down to earth, and interesting prof. I had a great time in the lectures. The papers are graded by the TA, so I don't think the tough grading is his work. There are a lot of readings, but they aren't overwhelming.

The best professor I have had at OSU, take his class! The courseload is not overwhelming, graded with a midterm paper, final paper, 2 analysis papers, and participation. These assignments are graded tough but fair. He is funny, great at teaching, and incredibly knowledgable in the field. This course has transformed how I look at the world. Take it!

I feel like I really learned so much. I absolutely loved the class and found the lectures so interesting. Professor Coleman really cares about making the learning experience fun but also very informative. I would definitely take him again if I had to. He really makes you work hard, but you will see it all pay off by the end of the semester.

Go to class! Not only is attendance mandatory, the material literally won't make sense otherwise. Great course, really broke down tough concepts in an accessible way. Will definitely take another class with him! (also you might leave with a teeny crush on Coleman)

Wonderful professor, I always looked forward to going to class. Very passionate in how he delivers information through lectures, as well as comical. Graded on a midterm, final, 3 surprise quizzes, and attendance. As long as you are interested in learning the material, read notes before each class to prepare for quizzes, you will pass with an A.

Hands down one of the most intellectually distinguished professors in the department. He really knows what he's talking about, and wants to communicate useful information about the real world. He's very frank and efficient with his pedagogy. Truly a lot to learn from him, and even though he can be a hardass sometimes, he's invested in your success.

Matt Coleman is one of the best professors with power point at OSU. He gives engaging lectures about complex topics, which his slides summarize very well. It was a very enjoyable semester taking his class.

Lectures are amazing and the only way you'll pass the class. That being said you will have to be somewhat interested in the material to do well in the class otherwise you'll fall asleep on some of this stuff.

Coleman may be the best professor I've had at OSU. It does take genuine intellectual curiosity to excel in his classes though. His classes are not typical academic experiences, so only take him if you want to challenge yourself, have an open mind and are willing to develop a new way of thinking. If so you'll have a great experience with Dr. Coleman

I loved this class and I've learned more in this one class than any others. I love his style of lecturing. I looked forward to this class every week and was able to take my knowledge outside of class. A bit difficult with just 100 points total, but totally worth it, and 100% possible to get an A because it's so interesting and easy to pay attention

Some students enjoy him and some do not. He is fully a scholar so get ready for a lot of ranting about his views, which he will shove down your throat. He's nice and willing to help, but be prepared to be confused. Answer very specific on tests because he is very picky. If you have conservative views get ready to be pulled at like always at OSU.

He takes himself way too seriously. 3701 is a required class for a lot of international studies specializations, but he wanted to teach the class like we were all senior geography majors. He acts like all of the topics he teaches are the monumental features of intellectualism and makes whatever his main points are inaccessible.

The track I was following involved cities and transportation geography, so, the course "Making of the Modern World" made me assume that this would be about the building of major cities around the world. WOW was I wrong. He makes his political leanings very evident in class which is very uncomfortable. Only 100 pts make up the class. STAY AWAY

I took this class as a GE and I made a mistake. People on this site rated him well, but I don't see any of it. Lectures are incredibly boring and tests and papers are super ambiguous. Avoid it if you can.

Don't take this class it's one of the hardest classes I've taken for it only to be a ge course. I should've taken this class at the community college would've been way easier. He takes Attendance everyday and it's apart of your grade. Exams are brutal you have to write  10 sentences on a topic for 4 topics HE chooses. Save yourself the time and RUN
He is a nice guy but this course might be a little bit difficult as a GE lecture
He is my favorite professor of all time.  He is extremely knowledgeable and passionate, and he makes complex concepts digestible.  I would recommend any student to take at least one of his courses.

The and the class were good. He's good an engaging students in the lectures. He often goes and tangents but they tend to be comical or about current events. There are pop quizzes but with mandatory attendance, you'll be fine, it's just a check to make sure you're paying attention.

Dr. Coleman is one of my favorite professors I've ever had. This is the second class I've taken with him and wouldn't be opposed to taking more with him in the future. He is one of the most down-to-earth guys I've ever met. I highly recommend taking one of his classes, you'll learn a lot of important things about the world we live in.

Best professor I've had at Ohio State, no doubt about it. Somehow, at age 40-something he manages to be cooler than most of the students he teaches. You'll be amazed by how cool political geography is-- and what with Dr. Coleman's post-Marxist/poststructuralist tendencies, if you take his class you're sure to be enthralled indeed.

If you don't quite /get/ the content it may be difficult - very conceptual, but I took to it fairly easily so I can't speak much to the difficulty there. Will say that it was an amazing class. Eye-opening, very different approach from what I've ever studied before - political geography is incredibly cool, and Dr. Coleman is the absolute cooooolest.

Coleman knows what he's talking about more than anyone I've had so far. He's genuinely passionate about what he teaches, and also makes the lectures fun and interesting. One of the best professors in the Geography department, if not Ohio State.

The class is so easy. Even if you study right before the day of 2 midterms and the finals, with 2-3 hours you can get A- easily. (I got 92% on both midterms, for the finals maybe around 98%-100%)There is 1 group project but very easy. Does give 2% extra credit. Grading is extremely easy. Take the class for an easy A gened. Textbook is never needed.

Coleman is a really good professor. His lectures are long and you actually have to listen to him to get the information but his tests are super easy if you review. His office door is always open and he's super helpful if you go to him. He does assign projects but they're easy to do and he'll guide you if you need it. I'm taking another class!
He was a cool guy that talks alot during lectures. Two tests, two projects, and final, and attendance is 20% easy. Tests are not hard. Projects are little bit tricky.

Without a doubt best professor I had in 4 years. This class should be mandatory for all US citizens. It was a very hard class, but Matt is the man. Extremely helpful and a wonderful teacher. Guy even helped me write my masters entrance essay. Take any class you can with this guy, HE IS ONE OF THE GOOD ONES!
Mat is incredibly knowledgeable and his passion for teaching and the discipline definitely shows. He is challenging but his courses are incredibly rewarding

Dr Coleman is AMAZING! The readings were difficult but explains topics so clearly. Discussions were great, grading was fair and very flexible. Also, to agree with the previous comments, he is gorgeous.

Phenomenal professor. He's extremely passionate, organized, funny, and explains complex issues very clearly. His lectures are always thought-provoking and he's super helpful outside of class, too. Must pay attention in class to get an A, but he's a fair grader and there's not a ton of extra work. And, he's really handsome, which is an added bonus.

Other than the fact that he is from up above (canada) he is totally hott!!! The earring helps alot!! And he wears a sports coat, what more should I say, he is very helpful and his study guides help quite a bit, and he is friendly and smoking hottt!!

I really enjoyed this class when I took it, so much that I used some of his info in a paper that I wrote for another course. He was fine with it at the time, but when I asked permission to use the info in my published paper, he shot back a really nasty e-mail. Maybe he had some personal issues over the summer or something.
Easy Class. I feel if there was a different TA, the exams would have been graded a little bit more stringently. Review sheet covers everything you need (and more)

Coleman is a great teacher.  He know his stuff and is interesting.  I disagreed with some of his political ideas, but if you can back up your case he will listen and not grade you down.  Recommend him to anyone.

Great Professor would recommend taking this class with professor Coleman for the GEC.  Very interesting and without a doubt the most intelligent professors I have encountered here at OSU. The best part is his intelligence doesn't hinder his ability to teach.  He does a great job of teaching without overteaching to a class of undergraduates.

Coleman is one of the most intelligent, organized, knowledgeable, engaging teachers I have ever experienced in my life.  He makes his students think practically and intellectually while engaging the subject thoroughly.  His class made me a better student, and pushed me towards a higher level of academic excellence than I had ever experienced.
Very willing to help outside of class. Lectures are interesting and well prepared.  Earned A with a lot of work. Great class!
awesome!  Great lectures, hard concepts, would not have taken the class with anyone else!  Earned and A with a lot of work, well worth it!
Great teacher, never really liked teachers and class until I had class with him
Absolutely wonderful teacher - personable, very well organized, and he makes the class interesting.

Very straight forward and fair. Readings have been reduced to a minimum. Attend every class and read everything assigned and it is easy to do very well. No trick questions on the tests. Very committed to teaching and his students. Great attitude and humor. Always made lectures interesting.
Willing to help out!

Do all the reading, attend every lecture. You can easily get an A if you put in the effort. Tests aren't obscure at all and he's definitely a fair grader. Very little reading. Coleman's a good guy and consciously tries to involve the class; you can tell he cares about geog. I would definitely take a class from him again.

I don't know what people are complaining about... the class wasn't easy, but it's a 400-level class! You have to read a lot and don't skip classes, but Prof. Coleman was very helpful and brought up some really interesting topics. People who struggled just didn't want to put in the work.
Not a good teacher at all. work load was quite hard and expected a lot from his students.
Hard work load, expected grad level work for an undergrad class.

He's a really cool dude, and obviously knows his stuff. The only trouble he runs into sometimes is thinking that all of his students understand grad-level concepts. But that doesn't happen very often, and if a student doesn't understand something he's always willing to help out. It's a tough class, but Mr. Coleman will give everybody a fair shake.

Class was heavy with readings and writing, but no tests for a 4 credit class. Watching movies is also a lot of time because you often have to rewatch it. A little boring at times, but is super knowledgable and willing to work with you outside of class.

I took 2100, Professor Woodworth created lectures on the spot, and rambled quite a bit. He is very interested in Taiwan/China relations & that is definitely a strong theme in the class. Lots of high level reading assigned for every class, was tedious. 4 assignments including exams total. Do the readings, come to class and its an easy A.
Weekly one page paper, exams, and a book report, but overall a pretty easy class and SUCH a nice guy!!! Really enjoy having him as a prof.

Very nice guy but his voice is super boring so lectures aren't the easiest to focus on. He does really care about the subject and his students though and makes the semester very pleasant. There is a one page paper due every week and a couple exams, but as long as you put in the effort it is possible to get an A

He really cares about his students success and understanding. This class was asynchronous so it's obviously lecture heavy but the discussions allow you to interact and give your point of view on the topic. Lectures are a little dry but interesting at the same time.

Dr. Woodworth has been one of the best professors I've had at OSU. While he does make you work for your grade, he is very accessible outside of class and is willing to help in any way. There is a reading response almost every week and the tests were a take-home which was nice. Class was always interesting and thought-provoking!

Dr. Woodworth has been one of the best professors I've had at OSU. While he does make you work for your grade, he is very accessible outside of class and is willing to help in any way. He's very personable and makes an effort to get to know his students, and is very passionate about what he teaches. Class was always interesting and discussion-based

Max is absolutely one of the best professors I have had at the OSU. As an international student, I felt REALLY overwhelmed and the readings seemed tough. However, I have not learnt that much in one GE class before. He is very caring and all of his lectures are super-informative. Never skip a class because his super long exams are based on them.

Max is one of the most fantastic Professors I've ever had. I took his Urban China course, which is done seminar style. Typically we had around 50 pages of readings each week for the class discussion, of which he does an exceptional job at administering and teaching. The final paper is worth the majority of the course grade. 10/10 would recommend.

my main issue with this class is that we were graded on so few things and received no feedback. we just received seemingly arbitrary grades for assignments with literally 0 comments. the class itself was not uninteresting, but i could have definitely found a better social science GE. not the easiest A, but do the readings and you'll probably be ok.

Best professor I've had in college. From his lectures, you can see how truly passionate he is about what he teaches, making it a lot easier to get into what he's teaching. Made me change my major after taking my first class with him. Just do the assigned readings and he'll take care of the rest.
Concise lectures with good reading material to supplement. He did not make us get a text book, which is amazing. So good.

One of my favorite professors ever. He is very knowledgable and passionate about development but also challenges students to think for ourselves about issues. Provides many points of view to a very tricky and controversial topic. Reading and writing heavy but very enjoyable class. I learned a lot and am very glad I took the class.

Dr. Woodworth is an awesome professor. He is extremely smart and knows a TON about China. He structures his classes in a way that is conducive to learning and no busy work. His classes are not overly difficult and he is always willing to meet outside of class to help students. Put in a little effort, do the readings, and you'll enjoy his class.

Dr. Woodworth is a very knowledgeable guy. Lectures were very interesting, although a little boring at times. There are five 3-5 paged papers graded by the TA that took a fair amount of time. There are a lot of readings that he expects you to keep up with, and test questions come from the book and readings. Midterm and final both easy as he gives a study guide. Very simple and up front guy

Knowledgeable and smart, lectures were very interesting though material was pretty easy. Excessive amount of work with a midterm, final, and five 3-5 page papers. Also assigns long readings and expects you to print them out and bring them to class and gets super passive aggressive when no one does because everyone reads them on their laptops.

Obviously very knowledgeable and passionate about what he teaches, makes lectures interesting. There's 5 essays throughout the semester mainly graded by the TA so it can be considered difficult, but they are 3-5 pages so if you are closer to the 5 page range you're good. Test questions are straight from the readings/textbook, so keep up with those.

Dr. Woodworth is an intelligent professor who is very knowledgeable in his area of study. He is clearly interested in what he teaches, and he enjoys helping students who are willing to ask for feedback. Great prof, expect a fair amount of reading, but most quizzes draw from these readings, and if not, they provide great perspective for students.

I changed my major after taking this class. A lot of work, but you learn a lot and he's not only a smart guy but also is really passionate about what he teaches. He values students that want to actually learn not just get an A.

His class is absolutely inspiring. A lot of discussion on economics issue and he always gives positive feedback. I really like the way he organized his classes and some deep insights into many problems. But there are a lot of readings out of class and be ready to write!
great teacher, a lot of readings but easy grade if you read

He's a really interesting professor. You should probably keep up with the reading and do it carefully as the tests draw straight from the text book. There are super annoying homework assignments. Exams are slightly difficult, but an easy A in the class if you try.

He's a nice guy and the class is interesting. There's a ton of reading and you have to write papers on the readings twice a week. He doesn't give a lot of feedback on assignments, so you have to go to his office hours and ask for help if you're not getting the grade you want. If you do the work, you will definitely pass.
good prof, interesting lectures. I learned a lot!
Ok class. Harder than I expected.  I went to every class and paid attention but some of the homework assignments and tests seemed a little difficult.
He's the nerdy kind of hot.

Exams are difficult! You should read your book VERY carefully! Attendance is mandatory even if lectures help little for exams. UNDERSTAND your BOOK is crucial. Weekly homework(Question set), and several writing tasks is the easiest way to get points in this course, which really helps you to get A(avoid pts deducted by these stuffs or impossible A

Extremely boring, very pretentious, and not really very clear about what is expected from assignments. Material is dull, long, and dense. In total, I learned very little about what his readings had to do with "Making the Modern World", but  it's not hard to get a good grade.

Prof. Woodworth is a great professor, who is passionate about what he teaches and about the students he teaches. Class is pretty straightforward bi-weekly 300-500 word reading summaries, a group project and final paper make up your grade.

Dr.Chan is an AMAZING professor! His basic meteorology course was very interesting and well taught even with all of the math. He gave a nice and organized summary sheet for everyone to use on exams and homework and also allowed open notes on all exams and even encouraged the use of AI during exams. His office hours are extremely helpful as well.

First time teaching this course, she made it interesting. The title was a bit misleading, with more of a focus on global health rather than 'life & death geography.' Each assignment was an interesting and worthwhile application of the content we covered, exams were open-note. Lectures are interesting and she incorporates videos relevant to content.

> Super passionate about the material and is really good at simplifying decently complex concepts.
> Labs are easy even if you have a harsh grader.
> Textbook isn't mandatory but if you want to do well, you should be reading it along with his lectures; they complement each other well.
> Lots of extra credit (up to 6.5 points) and rounds up grades.

I really enjoyed Alvaro's lectures and learning the material even though it was outside of my major. Alvaro really enjoyed teaching the material and he always did he best to make it more interesting for all the students. The class had two online midterms and an online final which were easy.

Lectures are long and not that interesting but he does his best to try to make them interesting. Quizzes/tests are moderately difficult given the breadth of material and how granular some of the questions can be.

He's nice enough, and the class isn't hard. You can tell he likes his job, he just isn't the clearest about grades. The labs are boring but easy enough, they're just graded by the TAs. Discussion posts every week on a service that we had to purchase separately, and the grades in Carmen aren't the same as your actual grade.

There's only two things I dislike about his class: 

1) Mandatory attendance
2) Doesn't put official grade weights in until the end of the semester.

Otherwise, very funny and accommodating professor. Always in a happy mood. He really wants his students to pass. Exams are online and labs aren't that hard at all.

Very sweet professor and really cares about your learning if you participate and ask questions. Some exam questions are difficult but labs can bring your grade up. Some extra credit options, too! Make sure to take notes during lecture or get them from someone else

Alvaro offers extra credit, but you have to do tedious work that lasts MONTHS to even get 4 points of extra credit added to your grade. By no means is this class extremely difficult, but be prepared for long, hard, tedious work on labs and lecture notes in order to get a decent grade.

For a low level class this sucked. Labs were easy but grading would vary between TA's. Lectures would just be him rambling, weekly quizzes were incredibly difficult. Made us purchase a $25 service so he wouldn't have to grade disc. posts. Exams were multiple choice or t/f. Take a different science lab GE.
Midterm and Final could be hard at times but the rest of the class wasn't bad.

DONT TAKE THIS CLASS. Online labs are graded unfairly by differing TAs, causing me to have lower grades for same data/info as others for no reason. Also, he had a different grading scale/weight system as the one we are given and DID NOT INFORM US, making me think I had an A- the whole semester when I actually had a B-. Insanely frustrating.

This is an easy GE with a lab. This was online due to covid. The labs are just video recordings of TAs doing the lab and we fill out the lab manual. I got 100% on every lab so far. There are a lot of lecture videos to watch but take notes and you'll have the quiz and midterm answers. His lecture recordings are entertaining. Class was asynchronous.

DONT TAKE AS ONLINE COURSE! I had heard this was an easy science GE, which is easy to believe for an in-person class. However, the way the professor has set up his class is just not meant for pre-recorded, online lectures. It's very hard to follow, for the slides are mostly guides and him just talking. Also, labs online are VERY time-consuming.

Overall good professor. Go to class for extra credit with participation (TopHat) and pay attention. He explains slides well and tests are based off of them. Exams aren't that hard and he gives multiple ways to get extra credit. HIGHLY recommend if you need an easy science course as the lab was really easy too.

Nice guy, the slides were often guides and you HAD to go to class to get a full explanation but it was easy to follow if you tried to pay attention. Stay on top of lectures, take detailed notes while hes talking and read over notes after class and youll be fine. All finals/ midterms were decent, but dont fall behind, or it will be get hard.

He is an entertaining lecturer, he talks fast but seems to be pretty passionate about what he is teaching which makes the class better. Attendance is taken through TopHat, so unfortunately you have to attend class. Overall he's a good professor and very straight forward class.

The problem with his class is he talks too fast in lectures to be able to comprehend the information, and it's a mystery of what is on his tests. However he is very knowledgeable on the subject, has a sense of humor, and is good at answering people's questions.

The only things that go into your grade are labs, tests, and top hat. He gives extra credit, but some of it is a lot of work. Labs are crazy easy, but the tests are a tad difficult. I don't have a background in geography, so it is hard to grasp the concepts bc he goes really fast in lecture. I get more help from my TA than from him.

Alvaro's lectures are boring and a pain to sit through. While he uploads the slides to Carmen, they don't have words and aren't helpful. The lab portion was the only thing I enjoyed, as it was easy and saved my grade. I got 65% on midterm #2 and 78% on the final and passed the class with a B. Attendance is taken every day online, 3 times a week.

Really knowledgeable but not the best professor out there. He speeds through slides and goes off on tangents every other slide. The lab is SO easy. Exams are tough because its hard to retain any sort of information from him. I went to every single lecture and wouldve been better off not going. Chance for 5% added to your grade from extra credit.

This class has fairly difficult content but if you go to class and pay attention you will do totally fine. Dr. Montenegro is the nicest guy, makes jokes and is entertaining throughout class. The lab is unrelated to lecture but very easy.

Dr. Montenegro is a nice enough man and quirky individual, but his lecturing skills leave much to be desired. He tends to ramble on incoherently, and moves quickly through his slides. He is silly and often goes on side rants about Brazil or booze. There is almost no uniformity or communication between lab, which is taught by a TA, and his lecture.
So good so far!
He is really passionate about what he is teaching but for this being an 1900 level class it was alot harder than my upper level classes.

I thought that he was really clear during his lectures, and he gave a take-home exam, which was nice. We needed to do a few presentations, and a long paper at the end of the semester, but Dr. Montenegro was a very fair grader and gave great feedback.

One of the worst lecturers I've had. Extremely boring and not very helpful. Unless you really love environmental geography, I would STAY AWAY from this class. TA teaching lab treats you like little kids and you never know what is going on because the lectures don't coincide with lab. He got angry when we asked questions during review. Terrible prof

He's passionate about the topic he's teaching, but he has an accent that can be hard to pay attention to and the lecture's are boring if you're not that interested in the material. The labs were super easy. He takes participation for a grade randomly. He's can be pretty funny. Study for the midterms and you should be fine!

TAKE HIS CLASS! I stopped showing up to lecture after the mid term and still got an A. The labs were a joke. The woman who taught it treated us like kindergarten students, going over literally everything. His lectures are super boring, but much of the material is common sense environmental stuff. Plus, he's really funny. Accent is not bad either

Really easy material but it isn't presented very well. He doesn't teach the coinciding lab so the material is often times unrelated and there are errors in communication between the two professors. I wouldn't recommend this instructor.

Syllabus is very vague. Exam dates aren't given until a week before the exam. Reads directly from the slides during lecture and argues with himself in front of the class. I haven't learned a single thing from his course yet this semester and the lab work is riddled with errors in the data. I don't know how to prepare for this class.

> PHD student who taught the 1 credit built-in lab for GEOG 1900. 
> Harsh grader who doesn't particularly help out students during the lab or guide them very much apart from the boilerplate slide presentation that's given at the start of every lab. Not good at feedback either.
> Could be wrong, but seemed acutely disinterested in being there.

What I really liked about this class was not only the material, but the opportunities for extra credit! He had about 10 throughout the entire semester, and they were a great way to learn about other fields regarding climate change and about other professors/groups on campus.

I took Geography 2800 (Climate) and Earth Science 2122 (Geology), and I don't think I would've passed this class if I hadn't already taken these two. Professor Mark is clearly knowledgable about the subject of global climate change and the history of the Earth, but he does not teach it well.
Dr. Mark is my favorite professor. His teaching style is lecture heavy, so if you suck at taking notes, you will probably do bad. Also he puts his kids in his slideshows.

Not for slackers. If you did bad its probably because you didn't come to lecture. Skill issue. Final project was hard, but rewarding. If you go to his office hours, you will find it easy to build a relationship with him and he will help you with things you are struggling with. Also, ask him about research opportunities.

Dr. Mark is clearly very passionate about teaching and cares about his students. Class is usually pretty engaging, and sometimes he uses TopHat to gauge attendance (if you answer them right you get extra credit!). My least favorite part about the course was the group project. Some calculations in the course, but nothing that'll tank your grade.
do NOT take this class. just don't do it. Both the professor and the TA are very condescending and rude. They will not help you and will take points off for no reason.

Reads off of the slides with no opportunities to take notes. He uploads them,but they are confusing and full of graphs with no context. A big part of your grade is based on a group project that does not have clear instructions. The professor also seems intent on giving bad grades to prove a broad lesson about how hard climate change solutions are.

Very boring and is not understanding at all. If you have an interest in climate change prepare to never want to think about it again after. Grades come in very slow and the papers and group projects are harshly graded.

Lectures were an hour and 20mins of him talking through a google slide. Very boring and a waste of time. It was heavy reading and quizzes and midterm was hard.
He gave us hard math calculations with NO guidance or help at all. DO NOT RECOMMEND him or this class.

I took this class and I thought it was very challenging with all the math I had to do, and he really didnt give us step by instructions on how to actually solve the math problems. Plus, I had to write 2 5 page papers, including 1 with an annotated as my final, and there was also a group project.
So hard. Such dense reading and homework. Goes way too fast. Wouldn't recommend!

Dr. Mark helped me with a lot of stuff outside of class when I was considering changing my major. This class is very easy after taking AP Environmental Science, as most of the content overlaps. Labs aren't too hard. Tests are easy. Reading the textbook helped me follow his lectures which could get a little tiring.

This class wasn't bad, and I am not a science major. The content in class was honestly not that important. Pay enough attention to do well enough on the quizzes he has every once in a while (I got 3/4's and 4/5's usually). Put a good amount of effort into the group project and the final and you will be fine. This class is not a first priority class

He's okay. Lectures are very boring and just full of pictures of graphs so test material is based mostly off of things he says in passing. Not very hard at all though so as long as you pay attention and study a little you should be fine. Group project at the end though is very frustrating, little direction and enormous groups but graded easily.

Brian Mark is very passionate about weather and climate. His powerpoints were vague regarding definitions or concepts, he explained them more verbally. Teaches fast. Labs are easy, which is 30% of the grade, but tests are difficult. There are 4 exams and about 11 labs.  Content and tests were hard for a GE

Great guy, decent professor. You'd definitely be better off rereading his lecture notes and posted resources as he really doesn't clarify unless you ask. He is pretty available outside class and whenever you go to him in person he's very engaging and helpful.

Professor Mark did a very poor job on connecting the material form the lecture to that of the textbook, making it very hard to get a clear grasp on what was important to know for the three midterm exams, which basically carry your grade. This class was far too difficult for a GE, but the labs are not THAT horrible.

This might be an easy class for Earth Science majors, but it is definitely more tough if this is a course you need to take only to fulfill a requirement. I did not enjoy lectures or homework assignments, found many of them confusing. Overall the class was okay, although not very organized.

Good professor who wants students to succeed. His lectures are unnecessarily jargon-filled and unintelligible - they don't have a clear flow and professor doesn't distill lecture down to overarching principles - which makes material hard to digest. Accessible professor with a passion for what he does. Willing to work with you to help you understand

The class was interesting, but I swear he spent more time shamelessly plugging campus events and outside-of-class lectures by the geography department than he spent actually teaching the material. Never skip class, no matter how useless it sounds. I skipped once at the end of the semester and that was the difference between an A and a B.
Interesting class, learned a lot, BUT workload was a bit high for a GE course. Read 2-3 articles a week, group presentation, three midterms, 6 page term paper, researched team debate, BUT no final.

The material seems like it should be easy when you read it but his exams are ridiculous. The questions are so specific that it's impossible to study because you never know what you're going to be asked. Professor Mark seems nice enough but he is insanely obsessed with talking about himself. Just don't disagree with him and you'll be fine.
He explains things clearly and is dedicated to helping his students.

The class structure is pretty enticing as a student: no exams, minimal homework outside of group projects, and a 5-6 page research paper due at the end of the quarter. Dr. Mark was knowledgeable, helpful, and a lenient grader to boot. I highly recommend the class.

He is kind of hard to follow and at the beginning I was overwhelmed but he is a fair grader and it was manageable. Their was an essay style midterm, two homework assignments dealing with math,a research paper 3-5 pages single space, an annotated bibliography 2 pages, a research paper 10 pages at the end of the quarter, and a final in class present.

This class can seem really overwhelming at first if you're not a science major, but he's a fair grader and will be willing to help if you ask. There is no book to buy, all readings are online and all mid-term questions were given to the class one week before we took it. We had two homeworks, both requiring some basic algebra at most.

DO NOT take this class unless you are majoring in Geography, and have advanced knowledge of Global Climate Change and the equations to figure it out. He is not helpful in explaining things at all. I'm a political science major and he expects me to be an expert in science.

A good course if you like having a lot of interaction with other students/ discussion-based classes.  Projects and debates were a little vague, but the homework was straightforward and relatively easy.  Though you can expect more work in this class than most others, overall, it was pretty engaging and Dr. Mark instructs the class well.
Very interesting class, at times, a lot of readings; "field trips" are interesting if you enjoy the subject matter; Dr. Mark is very knowledgeable and nice.

He was a decent enough teacher.  The class does suck, though.  Fortunately, he didn't make us take a final like some of the other profs do, and he actually dropped one of our debates because the work load was really high.  The reading is totally not necessary to do - it's easy to just wing it.  And really, the homeworks weren't that bad...easy math

He is fine, nice guy, pretty willing to help and decent sense of humor. The class however, sucks. It's just way too much work/reading/math(?), 2 class presentations, 2 in class debates, 1 discussion lead, insanely hard homeworks, paper, etc. etc. Unless you're totally into a ton of work, don't take this class.

The hardest part of the class is waking up to go to it at 8 in the morning. Labs are really easy and if you don't understand part of it, him and the TA are very helpful. The midterms aren't too hard, I probably averaged an A on the labs and a C+ or B- on the midterm/final and ended up with a B+ in the class. Never bought the textbook.

I wouldn't say it was exciting, but it was the best science GEC I've taken at OSU. I didn't buy the book, took sparse notes, and still managed an A-. But the lectures were helpful. I'd definitely recommend this class with Dr. Mark.
Great professor. Has a lot of knowledge. Was very helpful. Lectures were boring but it was the subject not his fault. Overall a highly enthusiastic instructor who I would recommend.

Got C's on the midterms, but A's on the labs - ended up with an A- due to curve. The 8am class sucked, but go to lectures and read the book and you'll do fine.  Or skip half the classes, cram the night before a test, and you'll do fine, too.  Don't miss labs, they're easy and worth lots of points.

apparently this is an easy class since I got an A, but honestly i thought the material was confusing for a non-sciences major like myself. brian mark is a nice guy though, and he does his best to communicate the info clearly. the real saving grace here were the labs, which are ridiculously easy and short.
He is not a good person at all. I had some problems with him.Didn't get along. Lectures are boring exams are tricky.
I took his first class ever at OSU, Spring of 2004.  He is a great guy and cares about his student's. Take his class whenever you can. Tests are not very hard.
Dr. Mark is a great guy- get to know him at office hours.  Very helpful, and is willing to personally review exams.

He may seen unsure of himself at times, but definitely one of the best professors I've had. Very willing to help, whatever it takes, treats you like a human being, tests cover lecture material, and one of the nicest guys I've met at OSU.

Does not know how to simplify material nor tie it into concepts. Extremely difficult to decipher notes and handwriting. Is late to almost every class, his homework reviews are never explained and it is assumed you are on equal level of mathematical capability of a graduate student. Avoid if possible.

Dr. Liu is very knowledgeable in Dynamic but it was difficult to stay on top of the lecture if you did not attend the class. The class only has homework and exams and both are straight forward and fair.

Dr. Liu is extremely knowledgeable in dynamics. However, when communicating it to students, it can be too complex at times to understand. Homeworks and tests are straightforward and fair, but are quite time consuming. Office hours are of great help.

Dr. Liu is very knowledgeable in Dynamic Meteorology, however he is not a good teacher. He unfortunately can not simplify the material enough so that students can understand it. His exams are straight forward and fair. He also curves so that everyone passes the course.
Great Professor! Such a fun and enthusiastic guy. Would definitely take his classes again!

Laid back professor, prioritizes weekly assignments and a research project. Gives 3 midterms, only keeps 2 highest scores. Lectures can be a bit repetitive, but attendance is graded from time to time. Overall interesting person, and a wonderful professor.

Lin is passionate about his career and it shows during his lectures. There is no required textbook for this class. There are occasional attendance checks, so beware. The weekly lab assignments are easy. The exams are open note and your lowest score gets dropped. Definitely take this class if you are looking for an easy A.

Dr. Lin's geography class is perfect for the natural science ge. Exams were open note and he offered a 40 point extra credit assignment that would boost your grade 10%. Only downside was random 10 point attendance checks in the lecture. Overall super caring and a great professor.
Easy professor and a nice guy when you get to know him. Enjoyed talking to him during office hours! By far the easiest 4 credit class at OSU.

Dr. Lin is an amazing professor who cares very deeply about what he teaches. His lectures are very interesting...if you're going into the weather field. His exams were very straightforward, and class assignments were simple to follow.

Easiest class Ive taken at OSU. Lowest final and lab is dropped. 40 point extra credit assignment. Go to review lecture because the slides give you all of the answers for exams. The labs were pretty easy. The lectures were pretty interesting and quick. Take this class if you need a GE science credit. As long as you try a little you will get an A.

Wonderful professor! Tests are very easy and open note and everything on the test are in his slides. Lectures are a little boring but attendance is not mandatory. I would highly recommend Professor Lin to anyone!

Professor Lin cares about the success of his students. There were 3 exams, all open note (with the lowest grade dropped), there was a very easy 40 point bonus opportunity, and the only other assignments were the weekly labs (lowest grade dropped). He is making many important discoveries in the field, but he keeps things easy for the students.

I took the class for an easy science GE credit and was surprised at well the class was put together. Professor Lin cares about all of the students and makes the class easier through open note exams, dropping bad grades, and offering a big extra credit opportunity.

I took this class as a ge and I really enjoyed it. Professor Lin understands that this class is a ge and doesnt make it harder than it needs to be. So much extra credit too, I ended with over 100%. Exams were open note too. If you want an easy class, learn a little about weather, and have a professor that is kind and cares take this class.

Professor Lin is a great choice for GEOG1900- drops lowest lab grade and lowest exam score (I skipped the third exam and still finished with 103%). Also do the extra credit assignment, it adds 10% to your total grade! His lectures were pretty dry, but attendance was optional so as long as you look through the slides, you'll be fine.

Most of your grade is from labs, so if you show up to labs and try you will be okay. As a lecturer, he really cares about his students and will try to make it as easy as possible for you. He really likes teaching and helps outline the exams so you do well on the 3 exams. One is dropped.
The easiest class Ive ever taken. And, the professor is an amazing human being and he really cares about his students. I wish that all professors were like him.
Let's you drop your lowest exam grade, so you can skip the final. Easy weather diary that is 10% extra credit. Gives review power points for each exam, just need to study those and will do well.

He thinks he's a great teacher and I think he probably does care, but he basically just reads off the slides with occasional stories. Research is his number one priority, but he also does give nearly everyone an A. Drops a midterm out of the three. No final. 10 percent grade extra credit. Sometimes pop quizzes when attendance is low.

He is an interesting man who really cares about his students.  The class wasn't hard, the one midterm was so easy, but the final presentation is pretty long and demanding.  He can be boring, but he tries to relate to us and share personal stories and experiences.  I would take another class with him.
Easiest class I've ever taken, 10% extra credit for writing the weather for 60 days, 3 midterms and drops lowest grade
just attend the class and study the review powerpoint. You will get an A.

This class was one of the easiest classes I've ever taken. He drops your lowest lab, quiz, and midterm, plus he gives you the option to complete a weather diary for a 10% bonus to your grade. All you have to do is show up because there are pop quizzes but the quizzes are 2-4 questions multiple choice
His lectures are really boring. But exams are easy and there are extra credits. You can even drop one midterm.

Professor Lin's class is very clear-cut in terms of what you can expect for the semester, as he drops lowest pop quiz, lab, and midterm. MANY opportunities for extra credit, although there is no curve. He loves what he does, and seems very passionate about the weather and nature. It's fairly easy if you go to class and labs.

Lectures are boring, as he reads straight from the PPs that he posts online. But have to go to lecture bc you never know when he is going to give a pop quiz- Worth 20% of your grade.. Midterms are easy, he highlights all things that will be asked (In red) in PPs (only thing u need to study). And he gives easy10% EC- Record 60 days of the weather.

This class will be a breeze if you have any stats or coding background. Everything is open note and the TA was always helpful but I never needed help beyond that so I can't speak to how helpful Dr. Liu is. I only saw him on his prerecorded lecture slides videos, never in person or on zoom. However, there is minimal actual map use or design.

Very clear expectations of students, learned a lot of useful information. I sometimes had trouble following the lecture vocabulary used, as my stats background isn't great, but with the textbook reference, it was no problem.
