Study beyond just the study guide provided for exams though, as other things will appear.

This class was hybrid, so the lectures were posted online each week with an in-person recitation. This made it hard to ask questions, but Dr. Liu was always available outside class. The structure of the class was great, labs had clear directions, and resources to prep for the midterm and final were posted on Carmen. Would take again.
I enjoyed this class. His expectations from you are obvious, and he is very clear on all the criteria. The assignments do help on tests, and he is very accommodating for disabilities.

Easy class of statistics. Labs are short and easy but useful, and you'll get a good grade. Exams matters, but as long as you do homework well, you'll get A. Exams contain essay and short answer questions about term concepts, and they are open note!

Dr. Liu makes things very clear and as long as you attend class, pay attention to the labs and get everything turned in on time, you will likely do well. His exams are fair and everything is kept straight forward.

Pay attention to the labs and you'll do good.  Group projects depends on the team.  Overall one of really good professor, ready to help you when you need it.  Also, attendance matter - normally his classes its 20% of the grade.
his exam and midterms preparations are misleading. be sure to read everything.

No matter how much effort you put into focusing in this class, it remains difficult due to the dull and disorganized instruction provided by the professor. Additionally, there are four assignments, each accounting for 16% of the total grade, and the TA are very harsh grader!

The most god awful boring professor I have ever had to sit through. Unfortunately attendance quizzes are random as well as group activities, if those did not exist 95% of the class would never show up. Avoid this class if possible. Gods speed

Prof. Le does a great job boring me in the class every time. She just reads off the slides and is completely dry while doing so. Not to mention the class is quite useless. She also grades in class participation ridiculously hard and sets high stand

Dr. Lee is one of the worst professors I had to take at OSU, her lectures are so boring. Not to mention that she grades TOUGH. She rarely gives participation credits. You show up to class, you do your task in class yet SHE BARELY gives you credits. She has nonsense HIGH STANDARDS for absolutely nothing. FIND ANOTHER PROFESSOR AND SAVE YOURSELF

a harsh grader that thinks she is the only one that knows everything, please do yourself a favor and don't take this class with her. She doesn't care about her students at ALL. It feels like she is there to make everybody's life harder. She reads from the slides and that's it.

She really cares about teaching and I enjoyed this class a lot because of that. Very interesting material in my opinion and the class work was extremely manageable. Probably spent 1 to hours a week on this class.

Dr. Le is great. The class was well organized and she showed current examples for the topics we learned. I really enjoyed the Map of the Day because it was usually about a problem that was relevant for the time. The assignments were also very well laid out (deadlines, instructions, etc.).

I have a really hard time with statistics and Professor Le really helped me learn. Attendance accounted for only 7% so it should be fine if you miss some sessions. I did think the final project was pretty hard, but other than that, a great class.

Dr. Le works her hardest to make the concepts difficult and convoluted. Material is not complicated in nature or hard to understand in other data analysis classes, but here it is awful. Assignments are unrelated to material, and instructions are too vague. Do not take classes with Dr. Le.

The textbooks have no correlation to the lectures, the lectures are boring and it's difficult to understand what is important. Attendance is a must. The assignments are sometimes outdated and poorly constructed. There are reading quizzes that are medium difficulty. Communication is poor. If you are not interested in data analysis stay far away.

I've taken this professor twice and he can be a very stressful professor to have. I don't like how he doesn't allow us to take notes on our laptops because he thinks that it's "distracting" and he has very stringent criteria for our research papers. He's also a Marxist, and can seem very biased, too. (I'm not a conservative, BTW).

You will learn about Marxism whether you are ready for it or not.   Notwithstanding the left leanings of his teachings, Joel is an excellent lecturer and passionate about his profession.  Probably the best professor that I have had at OSU since entering the Program60 in the Spring of 2020. There is some very difficult material in this class.

Terrible class and professor. 100 points in the entire class. Joel was out most of the semester, but was always up in the air about class and assignments. His lectures are NOT uploaded to Carmen, so don't miss class. Talks only about his own political views rather than teaching the class the required material. No technology in class. Have fun...

Philosophical conversations bore me to death, fell asleep during the rare times I showed up. I had to take it for my major, though. I didn't really go to class and only came for the exams. Every lecture is based on the readings, so just read them and you'll be fine.

I took Prof Wainwright's first year seminar on climate change and I absolutely loved it. It was a pass fail class and only one credit hour, so easy, but nonetheless great. He is so smart and I loved all the readings we had this semester. He inspired me to add a minor in sustainability, and I plan to take another one of his courses in the future,

I got obsessed with this course. I read close to 400 pages of political theory as a sophomore, and let me tell you, not a good idea. The ideological, socialist narrative he stresses to his students has its perks for sure, but it is so ideological that you have to be very careful in how you interpret it. Just be careful.

The single hardest class I've taken, but so worth it. Everything everyone says here is true. He is by far the most brilliant, knowledgable professor I've ever had, although the class is crazy difficult. You'll read a lot but learn even more. Last class made me bawl like a baby -- incredibly inspiring professor.

I love Joel Wainwright more than I love my parents. No but honestly, he is beyond inspiring. He might be a bit narcissistic, but honestly, he kind of deserves to be. He is so smart it will drive you crazy, but he also engages with students-- especially those who show up having done the reading, inquisitive, and invested. best ever.

5700 is my favorite class so far and Wainwright is brilliant. Left lectures with my mind blown every time; really changed how I view the world. Wainwright challenges his students and the onus is on you to keep up with the very theoretical material, but he is accessible. Tests and one paper are the only grades. Can't recommend highly enough.
A brilliant professor with magnetic lectures to which you need to pay close attention for more difficult exams than OSU's average professor.

Dr. Wainwright is by far one of my favorite professors. I had his lecture on climate change and he really knows his stuff. Hes very easy to talk to and is super kind. If he taught all of my classes I would certainly enjoy college much more.

Professor Wainwright is the best teacher I have had at OSU! Each of his lectures is like its own stand alone, extended Tedtalk. Also the work isn't too too hard. If you pay attention to the lectures and write decently, you don't really have to read anything.

the only one that comparatively harder than him could be a chemistry professor though I have to admit that he's truly brilliant. but the class' been way too difficult. but it deserves your time. I only expect a C or B in this course.

The best thing I can tell you about Dr. Wainwright is that everyone who has said anything on here is right. He is a divisive but passionate academic who is somewhat disconnected from the student experience, but that matters, because it's obvious he would rather reinvent that experience, anyway. He's a good guy, but be ready for a tough class.

Honestly the best professor I've ever had. He truly cares about what he is teaching and passionate about the topics. He was extremely well prepared and knowledgeable about the topics, probably the smartest teacher I've ever had. He gives amazing lectures and I would love to have him again for another class. Great guy.
Really good class, but DO NOT MISS and read the damn readings. Our TA was an easy grader so I lucked out. Good lectures, always leaves you mind blown.

Dr. Wainwright is probably the best quality professor I've ever had and is a very good lecturer. However, I felt like I was being led to believe in Communism and that pseudo-Marxist revolution would be a good idea. Don't drink all the cool-aid, but he is insightful so take it for what it's worth. He cares about his work and is a unique professor.

The exams are extended response and you have to know readings pretty well. The exams are intimidating but doable. The two papers aren't bad, short and easy. Joel is really awesome. He stays behind every class and talks to the students, answering complex questions and helping clarify things. I usually end up staying 30+ minutes after just to listen.

There are plenty of readings in the class, however he delves into most of them during class time so I didn't feel it necessary to read much. (I was only aiming for Bs though, which I got). He gave great insights about the state of world affairs and I solidly recommend it for all IS majors at OSU.

teaches an outdated Material and views no longer applied in development and economics..  The most recent data he uses is from early 90s. Clearly doesnt respect if a personal point of view is different from his. Expects to read 200 pages a day and doesnt provide  study guide or review at all.

Geography of Development was the best class I've had at OSU. I left every lecture with a 'mind blown' feeling, thanks to the brilliant lectures of Wainwright. That being said, I wish I had taken a pre-req beforehand for baseline knowledge about development. I was graded harshly on the paper--Joel was inaccessible for help when asked, no office hrs.
Dr. Wainwright is clearly passionate about his work. He engages students and challenges everyone to think critically and defend their beliefs. This was one of my favorite geography classes so far!

This class should have prereqs. It was my first Intstds class, and I didn't do well. He expects you to walk in with a full background in diplomacy and give him highly theoretical essay exams. Read and study all you want, but if you don't have a strong background in the stuff already, you won't get more than a C.  Also, he's pretty rude to students.

This class is phenomenal.  Most inspiring teacher that I've ever had. The class is not easy, but this is college --you should be challenged-- and that's exactly what this class will do to you. Though he may seem intimidating to talk to- when talking to him one on one he was very helpful. You'll be pushed to think critically in this class.

Lectures were interesting but the reading load was ridiculous (50-100 pages each class). 3 exams and 2 papers, grades EXTREMELY tough. Pretty much impossible to get above a B in this class. He is extremely condescending and strict. If you turn in the paper on the day its due, but after he begins lecture, it is considered a day late. Avoid him!!

If u can avoid him do so at all costs. He thinks he's teaching middlehigh schoolers. He is rude, ignorant&doesn't grade u on the material learned, he grades on whether u can write a "good" essay or not. Doesn't make and effort to work with students. No technology policy. No need to do the readings if u come to class. Worst classteacher at OSU

Dr. Wainwright is a great lecturer and encourages students to think for themselves. However, he often pushes his beliefs onto students by presenting them in one-sided arguments. Attendance is not mandatory but if you don't do the readings (there are a lot) and attend class you will fail. This class is not easy, a B+  is probably equivalent to an A

Incredible professor, highly recommend this fascinating class. His lecture are very engaging and he really knows his stuff. Lots of reading but it's interesting stuff and you can skip reading now and then and be fine. Test are completely essay based and there are a few short writing assignments. A very fair grader.
Dr. Wainwright is by far the best professor I've had at Ohio State. He is truly inspiring. The class is not "easy", but it is more than worth taking.
Professor Wainwright is a truly inspiring teacher, one of the best I've ever had.  The class was absolutely fascinating.

If you pay attention in class and take decent notes that's all you really need for the exams. The readings are helpful but ultimately just optional on top of his lectures, also the few short papers are directly based on the readings but you get to choose which one you write about.

One of the best professors I've ever had. Extremely smart and knows his stuff. The class is hard and you have to attend every class or you will be lost. I hope to be able to take another class with him in the future.

At the end of the semester our class gave him a round of applause. I have never seen that before. He is the best college teacher I ever had. Tests are hard, but if you don't take his class you miss out on one of the best teachers you ever seen.

The material is interesting, but the grading is insane. Don't take this class if you care about your GPA--especially if it's only for a GE. A lot of people liked him, but I thought he was a bit of a snob.

Exams are brutal (essay based; study method=rereading all notes and readings and hope you remember the detail he asks about), reading is insane, but I probably learned more from this class than any other I have taken so far. Dr. Wainwright is awesome and I don't regret taking this class at all, even if my grade wasn't where I wanted it.
Incredible professor. You should take this class!

It was an interesting class, the first part was definitley more interesting than the second. You will have a TON of reading to do, so make sure you don't take other classes that have a lot of reading. There's two papers to write that aren't bad, but his exams suck, they are all essay-based. Wainwright is cool for the most part.

This was one of my most memorable courses at Ohio State.  This course can be challenging, but Joel is a very engaging speaker - each class period is interesting and thought-provoking.  He encourages discussion, so try not to be shy.  Attendance is not mandatory, but it's in your best interest to attend every lecture.
Professor Wainwright is probably the best professor I've had my college career. He is very challenging but extremely helpful. He really knows his stuff. I highly recommend his class
Professor Wainwright is one of the best professors I've had at OSU. He does a great job of explaining things and is a phenomenal speaker. I would definitely take another class taught by him.

Amazing professor. Sometimes he comes across as a bit pretentious but without doubt the best professor I have ever had. His lectures are impeccable. Class is not easy but it will be the most fun and engaging class you'll have your whole college career. Oh and when the weather is nice he lectures out by mirror lake!
Easily the best course I have taken at OSU! Exams are challenging but fair and he is willing to help with the research paper (recommended some great sources).
Awesome professor but extremely hard grader. Learned more in this class than any other class I have taken at Ohio State.
The best professor I've had at Ohio State.  His class is a challenge but you'll learn a lot!

Best teacher I've ever had. One of few classes that actually makes you feel smarter. He is a great speaker and excellent at explaining things. He is also very patient when people don't understand something.

Admittedly, he is a good teacher.  But you should make sure that you agree with his point of view.  Even if you don't, however, you can simply amend your ideas and writing to his liking and you'll do fine grade-wise.

Hardest class I've taken thus far. But totally worth it. FIrst class I've taken where I feel like I've actually become smarter. I learned so much and even though the first couple weeks were hard to get through, the content becomes so applicable to life and infinitely useful. TAKE THIS CLASS.
Smart, intelligent, and critical. Speaks in clear English and sounds like a public speaker at times. As long as you read, you should be able to pass the class.

Easily the best professor I have had at OSU thus far. Wainwright's lectures are extremely compelling and makes you want to learn, but expect at least 75 pages of challenging reading each week. He is so good at teaching Gee and Archie Griffin interrupted our last class to give him a prestigious faculty award. No joke.
He is by far one of the most passionate professors at OSU. He makes you want to go to class everyday and learn so much. Class is hard for a 200 level but its worth it! (Eye-Candy)
By far the best professor at OSU, he is so passionate about what he teaches and just makes you want to learn so much!
Easily the best teacher I've had at OSU. Class is challenging (lots of reading) but Wainwright makes it interesting and keeps your attention. Wish all my professors were as good as him.
I adore this man. Absolutely brilliant lecturer. Increadible intelligence. You will not regret taking a class with him (unless you want something easy)
One of my favorite professors of all time. Assigns a lot of readings, but I always look forward to class!

He is one of the best professors at OSU period.  His classes are not easy but they are extremely interesting and you will be able to think more critically and have a better understanding of how the world works.

the class is challenging and WAINWRIGHT is one the best teacher i ever had at OSU.but he is very stingy in grading.i don't know if it is him or his T A Seung that is doing the grading, they need to do a better job
Tough class, but very interesting. he's a very intelligent man just trying to make you think critically. I genuinely feel smarter after taking this class. Highly recommended.

Complaint or criticism of the modern world is unfounded without examination and understanding of how it came to be. The making of the modern world is clearly and enthusiastically unpacked by this fantastic professor. Always willing to help, even when it came to extending office hours, Joel is all I expect and desire of a professor and more. Enjoy!

I really enjoyed this class. The reading could be confusing or boring but he cleared everything up really well in the lectures. He's a great lecturer and made it fun! I will be taking another class with him.
Witty...interesting...He may very well be a geo genius. Overall, one of my favorite profs at OSU.
Awesome personality, very intelligent, phenomenal class!
Super interesting and fun
valuable resource.. dorky

I took both 630 and 642. Both courses require a lot of reading (close to 1,000 pages), but the material is very interesting and original. Be prepared to work very hard, but you will get a lot out of the class. The professor is easy to talk with, and has a genuine interest in working with students.

To get a good grade A LOT of reading is required as well as regular class attendance. As long as you write the general large ideas covered in class, you'll do ok on the exams. A 20 pg research paper is required as well & as long as you have a clear thesis & put thought into it you'll do fine.
The class itself is incredibly easy but the lectures are really dry. While this class is not hard and and easy class in your schedule, it may bore you in the process.

If you want to learn climatology, it's better not to take this class when taught by Dr. Lin. Assignments and midterms are so easy that you will feel like a child and might loose interest in this class. Recommended if you need easy grades.
Extremely nice guy and really easy to get an A in this class. Also, pretty interesting material even if you're not into science. I would recommend this class.

I enjoyed him and his class. He is very generous with his grading, and is organized. It can be difficult to understand him at times, but I never had much trouble with that. You can tell he enjoys teaching and helping the students. He has great advice on how to develop in-class presentations.
Definitely take this class if you can. Although the material can get technical, Dr J is a nice guy and a lenient grader (lowest midterm is dropped).

This is the easiest class ever. When there are "pop" quizzes, he basically goes over the material. He let us drop one of everything, so if you do well on the first two midterms (all multiple choice), you don't have to take a final. We watched a lot of movies too which helped kill time and was a break from powerpoint slides

He was always nice and seemed interested in what he was teaching, but it was incredibly difficult to understand him...especially at 8:30 in the morning. Good intentions, but difficult to learn from if you need things explained out for you.

Quick responses via email and canvas. He is obsessive about his subject which is good yet his delivery method needs some help. I would have liked to see easier grading on such a niche topic when it came to homework and perhaps a few more of those assignments. 
This class requires you to proofread your work and study the lecture slides.

Harv is a good dude. Transport security is a pretty niche subject but he gave some absolutely great lectures - not super engaging but good - and showed he cared about the subject. Class was easy with not too much effort needed except for the final paper. Rumor has it u get extra credit if u wear a bike helmet to class and talk abt sustainability

Harvey is the best at what he does. Adds a social perspective to an otherwise highly technical field of work. First impression was that he was a bit smug/arrogant, but he's clever and generally friendly if you get him talking about bikes. 5301 was a fantastic class, learned so much and changed my perspective on a lot of things. Would take again.

A very amazing class with Kendra! It's one of the two capstone classes for geography students, and I wouldn't be too worried about it. Just relax and do the work that you have to do for it, and be prepared to discuss readings in class.
Just come to class and labs

Kendra was an amazing instructor! She made sure classes were engaging, even with topics I previously was not interested in. She gave students opportunities to share their opinions and experiences with each subject, which made it more interesting. Even though it was an early lecture, I was excited to come to class throughout the entire semester!

I took a class with this professor last semester and I thought she was just OK as a professor, so I don't get where all the positive reviews are coming from, to be honest. She seemed a bit arrogant and had a very monotone voice, but other than that, the class was very easy since there was only 1 test and a final paper.
Dr. McSweeney was very smart and cared about the content she was teaching. She was very welcoming and warm to students and it was one of my favorite classes and lecturers so far!

I cant say enough good things about Dr McSweeney. Shes the best. Honestly. Go to office hours. I PROMISE you wont regret it. She genuinely cares about you and your interests. 2800 is pretty interesting, but Dr McSweeney is the star of the class. Take her classes as much as possible

Dr McSweeney is incredibly intelligent and kind. I loved taking GEOG2800 with her; her teaching is so relaxed while also effective. It is very easy to listen to her and take in the content without feeling bored. Attendance is taken every lecture, and she tests you about things not covered in the power-points, so show up! It'll be worth it.
A phenomenal individual and great class with a plethora of materials awaiting further exploration by the eager mind. If you are not an eager mind, do not waste your time and go the business school.
Very open-minded and easy going. Show up, take some notes, and pass. Brain dead course and she offers extra credit for watching a movie or seeing a speaker with a topic relevant to the course

Professor McSweeney was nice and she was clearly knowledgable about the topics. In regards to tests, she listened to students and she would use our feedback to prepare for the next test. For ex., we all hated the T/F questions so she stopped putting them on our tests! Easy gen ed course for sure, it's a 3 credit hour w/ lab! Definitely recommend.

Kendra has a reputation for being a good teacher. However, I found that she doesn't put much time or effort into teach and instead relies on her obvious charisma / likeability. She also didn't do much teaching. She largely told everyone what she wanted you to think about the topics and you were expected to agree.

I absolutely adore Kendra. She's very interesting and easy to listen to. The class is really light on course load. No exams, but two papers, a debate, and a map quiz. This is my second class with Kendra as my prof (which was done purposefully). Overall all, really easy but fun and insightful. Definitely take her class!

Dr. McSweeney is my favorite  prof at OSU! She's brilliant, engaging and will really make you think. And she's always happy to meet with students in office hours unlike some Geography profs (Malecki) who don't like to make time for us lowly undergrads...

Easier than any of my high school science classes.  She's super nice and just wants every one to get good grades.  Go to class and pay attention and you won't have any problem getting and A.  The labs are super easy also.

One of my favorite professors of all time, the class was interesting and she updates the material to reflect current events. However, one of my favorite parts was her responsiveness to students and helping us to succeed.  After the first exam, she decided to get rid of the components that caused the lowest scores for future exams. Great Class!

Dr. McSweeney is a great professor, and 2800 was not very difficult either. Her lectures are interesting, and she welcomes feedback and discussion. There was never any homework (except for two take-home labs), and the only tests were the exams.

2100 was a pretty easy course. Easy grading and clear expectations on assignments. It is easy to skate by in the class but the material is pretty interesting, too. She has field experience in the region so it makes brings the lessons to life in a cool way. She is pretty interesting to listen to. Take this for an easy and interesting GenEd credit.

Great mixture of applied work and academic articles to help you in the field.  She's approachable and frank about the material.  One of the most helpful instructors I've had. Even though the department has its ideological divides, she's an excellent bridge that helps everyone to make their own work count.
Great person, great professor.  Take every class you can with her.

Plenty of reading but that is the only hard part of Kendra's class. You get out what you put in, which is how college should be. No TESTS!!! She's really nice and knows her stuff on Latin America too. Take her class!

One of the best teachers I've had at OSU. There's a lot of reading but once you get past that and pace yourself on the project you'll do alright. She made the class really fun when it could've been excruciating by having open discussions. She really pushes you to participate and share your thoughts.
great professor. really helpful and easy to talk to.

She is a great teacher. She keeps information interesting. She will stop talking about a subject if the class doesn't find it interesting and will move on to something that people care about. There's a lot of reading, but it's worth it, take a class with her if you can, she's great.
take as many classes as you can with her, great teacher.
kendra is such a great teacher. she is hilarious and makes the class so much fun. if i had the chance, i'd take all my geography classes with her!
Prof. McSweeney was awesome, and she made the subject matter interesting.
Kendra ROCKS!
Was a decent class.  You must show up every day.  The material is so so, in that it can become dry.  But Kendra made it interesting.  She's a good teacher.
explains things pretty good, labs are easy. and if she was a mom, **** :)

I would highly recommend Kendra's class to other students because she is an excellent professor.  I learned a lot in her class, and it has proved to be very helpful in my other Geography class this quarter. It's a lot of work, but it's worth it! :)
Excellent prof! Wish I could have her for all my classes -- smart AND gorgeous!
Nice lady.  You have to work hard, but it's not too bad.  MAkes it kind of interesting.

Class is easy, each week there are a couple assignments/quizzes that make up 6% of your grade and a final assignment worth 13%. Class may be easy but good luck if you ever have an issue or need to contact the professor or ta. They never respond quick to email and there's a discussion post for students to ask questions that have never been answered.

Truly a great professor. I loved his class very much and he was always helpful and understanding. The information in lectures was pretty interesting and the class was the perfect level of difficulty. Not too easy but not absurdly difficult. Jim gave good feedback and graded more than fairly. I think he is retiring so I wish him the best!

Jim is a really amazing professor. His class was so engaging and he was clearly passionate about what he was teaching. I honestly looked forward to his class every week. The class is pretty discussion-based but we were all encouraged to think critically. Jim is overall an amazing guy and a really incredible instructor.

I absolutely adored this class. Professor DeGrand encouraged us to think for ourselves and challenge what we already knew. It was very clear how passionate he was about the subject material, and he is overall a great guy. He also provided a lot of flexibility when it came to things like due dates and always took students feedback into consideration

Jim was a fantastic instructor, He was always willing to help when students had technical issues. He made sure that we were well informed and prepared for lab reports and even made tutorials to explain concepts. I wish he taught more ASP courses. I would recommend him to anyone. :)

COVID made this class super easy cuz he didnt make us take any finals or midterms. I didnt read a word of the textbook. The labs are a real pain, but not unbearable. Jim is a great guy, funny and cares about teaching. Take this class if you need a lowkey and easy credit for science.

I took his biogeography class, it wasn't too difficult but I definitely had to put in a decent amount of work for an A. He class had two tests, variously weekly assignments, a major semester project, and two 3-hour homework assignments. Though his class took work, Jim is an awesome dude who's passionate about natural history.

His tests are unbelievably difficult. Some if not most of the exam material is not covered in class or in the text, it's up to you to figure out. The single most unnecessarily difficult 1000 level course I have ever taken. His lectured were unstructured and extremely difficult to follow.

Graded by easy lab assignments and 3 mid terms. Exams are easy if you read the assigned chapters and do the practice tests. Lectures can be long and somewhat boring, but this should be an easy A if you put in a little effort.

Jim is definitely a great guy that means well, however the structure of his tests are so difficult that the majority of the class gets less than a B on each one. He offers extra credit but it does not make up for the tests that are made to yield around a 70% class average

He's a genuinely funny, charming guy who is invested in your success and cares about effective teaching. He's no pushover though. You will earn every point in his courses (but he allows you to make up for mistakes by investing in extra credit, so take advantage early). Best to just go to his lectures. Don't skip, you'll save effort if you go.

He's a nice guy, but tests are very difficult. I recommend reading the book for the first midterm and pay attention to everything he says in class, He'll post the powerpoints, but the midterms will be more challenging than need be. Do EC cloud obs everyday to save your grade.

Funny and nice. Always available to help. Learned a lot. Book isn't needed, but helps if you don't understand something. Extra credit through a DAILY cloud observation on an iPhone app. Takes 2 minutes of your day, but he gives 7% added to your final grade if you do it. You'll need it, exam average was below 70%. Class might seem easy, its not.

I took his 1900 Geography class. I will avoid taking another class by him again. I attended lectures and labs and read the book and studied all the powerpoints for his exams and the class average was a C or below. Only a handful of As. And he expects this. He does not cover material in depth the way he tests you over it. Confusing language.

He knows a lot and has entertaining lectures. The labs and homework are easy, but the exams average a C- so good luck. Overall class total average is a C at end of year. I would avoid the class unless you excel at this topic. There will be roughly 10 A's at end of year out of 200 students.

I took his 5922 class as part of my Atmospheric Science major. He is extremely knowledgeable about the subject matter, but isn't always 100% clear about assignments. However, he's always very willing to answer questions and go over instructions. He's probably the most approachable instructor I've ever had, and one of the most knowledgeable.

Doesn't make expectations clear and then takes away points on assignments on things that were never even mentioned or part of any reading material. Lectures pointless but takes attendance. One of the worst organized classes I have ever had. Nice enough guy, but should not be teaching.
Lectures are confusing. He is very confusing to understand. Monotone.

This man is probably the worst teacher/lecturer Ive had in my three years here. He would ramble in a monotone voice for almost 3hrs in a way that made it 100x more confusing, mainly saying irrelevant examples then backtracking. I have never had such a hard time forcing myself to stay awake in a lecture. Hes a sweet man, sure, but a TERRIBLE prof.

Honestly, Harold was pretty chill at first, he didn’t give any work and the class was easy. Flash forward three weeks in and I catch him spreading his gooch hairs on my exam after I handed it in, kinda weird move tbh. Overall would watch that again though highly recommend this class.
To get the best grade, be sure to regurgitate his words back to him in each assignment and test. Otherwise, its the curve for you.

His classes are boring, frustrating, and dated. It is a shame that this man is teaching classes required for many majors. A councelor told me not to include the grades recived in his class in my GPA calculation. Tip for passing exams: spew everything he told you, and mention his name.

The classes were interesting but far outdated.  He is stuck in the 70's as are his lectures.  If these classes were optional I wold have never taken them.  When in college I had a 3.7 GPA and never scored over 45% on his tests which in most cases were A's on his scale.  This class needs new blood and new information to keep students competitive.

This prof felt he was the smartest man in the department, and he very well could have been.  But he would impose his intelligence in a way that would make students feel inferior to his supreme intelligence.  The labs were worthwhile, but only because he didn't teach them.  Exams weren't that bad, but I have studied maps since high school.  He did make them rather difficult, however.

Haven't had him in years, but he needs a warning. Nice guy, but boring class and impossible exams. The key to doing well in his exams is to write down everything you can think of relating to the topic regardless if it's relevant to the question or not.
Horrible

He will crush you with painfully difficult tests and terribly boring lectures.  Don't expect to pass his exams.  Just answer a question in class once every 3 weeks and you'll be fine.  He is a helpful guy...a bit full of himself...but helpful nonetheless.
The worst teacher ever in the history of mankind. Ironic that he thinks he is the greatest.  A bitter, old man that should retire, or be forced to leave by the department.
rambles on too much,the tests are essay based and the average was like a 30.terrible teacher
It is not cool for people to get 25 out of 100 on an midterm and it is ok.  Also, if the computers weren't in front of my face I would fall asleep.

Takes simple concepts and goes round and round in circles, deeper and deeper until everyone falls asleep. Tests are all essay, and graded extremely hard. Ask questions and he likes you, though, and that helps.
No Comments
This guy would let you drown in your own spit. worst class expoerence ever.
Obviously intelligent, boring, expects encyclopedic knowledge of the material.

her lecture always makes students sleepy, and it's boring if you are not interested in human geography. But there are only 8 map quiz, 4 exams, and no finals. You'll get a good score if you try to memorize the worksheet. Maybe it's a little bit difficult for GE, but it's interesting for me to know some human geography all over the world.

The most boring class ever. She talks about 1 slide for 30 minutes. Half the class doesn't even show up. Then she expects you to know SO MUCH for the tests that are taken at the testing center. She doesn't realize this is just a GE for everyone.
Not good
She forces you to go to the stupid testing center instead of taking exams in classes.
Terrible professor, boring class.
Thank you.
Good professor,
Porfessor Chabot is a great and kind person. When I encounter difficulties she was always willing to help me. She is also a great teacher, if you do the work you will have no problem.
The class was way too difficult. You are expected to remember everything she said during lecture. Tests and quizzes are taken in the testing center. I worked pretty hard and only earned a C+

Cindy Chabot has been my professor for 3 different geography courses, and she's definitely my favorite. She is very kind and is quick and generous with grades. Many comments on here appear to be students who may have blown off the class or not been interested in geography. If you are serious about college, she's a great professor.

She's an amazing lecturer. The course is very interesting and she adds some anecdotes that can help connect to the material. The grade is based on 4 exams and some map quizzes. I never bought the textbook, which you can get by on doing only if you attend every class and take notes on the lecture.
Most boring lectures I've ever had to sit through....

The class had four exams consisting of mc's, short answer, extended response and extra credit. She gives questions to do as you read through the textbook and an extensive study guide that makes the exams easy. Don't take if you frequently skip class & don't read textbooks. She is a perfectly fair grader and is always willing to help.

A lot of people rate her badly, but I really enjoyed her class. There is a lot of info to know for exams, but she gives very clear study questions and all the essay and short answers are taken from those. She also tells you exactly what you need to read. She's really nice, too. If you take notes in class and do the study guides, you will do well.

Expects ENTIRELY too much. Exams consists of several mc, short answers, and 4 essays. She expects you to know every minute detail. And there are 4 exams throughout the semester. Way too much for a class many take as a GEC.

Most terrible professor I have ever had. She puts WAY too much information the the exams, be prepared to know information on hundreds of countries from the 1400's until present. IF YOU CAN GET DROP THE CLASS, DO IT!!!!!! I promise you will regret taking this!

she is the most boring teacher ive ever had. She literally will spend 30 minutes on a single slide just rambling about nonsense. The study guides are literally 300 questions for each test basically asking a question for every page of each chapter. IF YOU THINK THIS IS ACTUALLY GEOGRAPHY YOUR WRONG! Only extra credit if geography, rest is politics.

This was a great class.  I see a lot of people rated this class low, but professor Chabot makes it very easy to get a good grade if you do the work.  For every chapter she has a study guide with the specific pages you should read and the questions you must be able to answer.  While this is time consuming it is an easy way to get an A.

Class is boring. Harder then it needs to be. Alot of info required for exams. Basically a waste of time. Expected us to know too much when no one cared. extra credit quizzes,optional paper. dont take unless you actually like geography. i regretted wasting money, time and energy on the class.

the class was pretty hard definitely read the book and the study guide she gives, all the test questions come from there, lecture was a little boring but mandatory. Overall funny teacher but makes the class harder than it should be and easy extra credit points!

This class was supposed to be a GEC, and she made it much more difficult. Her lectures were pointless yet you were required to go to them because of the quizzes. She would spend most of the time telling stories rather than actually teaching the material

This is a pretty easy class. She offers easy extra credit map quizzes and the project you have to do is graded very easily. The tests are not bad either, but you have to put some effort in. The only bad thing is you have to read the book and attendance is required and she is pretty boring, but overall should be an easy A- or A

Class is super-easy so long as you follow prof's very excellent online reading guides. Map quizzes are extra credit and project isn't really that hard. Class is pretty dry but a good way to learn about a lot of different places.

This class was very easy but you MUST attend class or your grade gets docked.  Do all the readings on carmen and follow those questions  because those are verbatim on the exams.  Quizzes are all extra credit and can really pad your grade.  Paper is graded tough.

Oh my goodness. I was feeling homocidal in at least 90% of the lectures because they were so boring. The in-class videos were from the 1980's and were just painful to watch. You must read the textbook. Finished with over 100%, but I am not sure it was worth it at all. Take the class with a more interesting professor.
dry

Although the class is very easy as long as you read the book and take the hour or so to study for the 8 quizzes, she is an AWFUL teacher. Not only is attendance mandatory, but you have to listen to her monotone voice talk about things that are irrelevant to the tests. Bring other work or sleep. Class is pointless other than the videos shown.

I don't even know. She talked every class about pointless things that didn't show up on our exams at all, including staying on 1 map for an hour. She seems passionate about the class but it was nothing like I expected and going to mandatory lecture stupid, it would have been better to read the book each 2 hours we had class. Not recommended, sadly.

Very easy class, although somewhat boring.  Lectures were almost painful to sit through, and attendance was mandatory.  Quizzes were a easy, exams even easier, finished with like a 99% or something ridiculous.

Shes a very sweet lady. Sit in the front or else you probably will find it difficult to pay attention. She tends to drone on. As the class progressed it got more and more interesting. Read the textbook material and fill out the study/reading guides she gives you. They are extremely helpful. STUDY FOR THE EX. CREDIT QUIZES. They will save your grade

She takes attendance and you're only allowed 2 absences before it hurts your grade. Also, she gives extra credit in the form of quizzes which is hard to get because you have to memorize like 100 countries and cities combined, no joke. Three tests make up the class so if you don't test well.. not recommended..

She is really nice and always offers students her help. The the class is compromised of 3 tests. She also has about 8 quizzes where she will give you a list of 30-50 countries and cities you have to find on a blank map. On the quiz, she picks only 5 cities and countries which is rediculous! The quizzes can't hurt your grade though, just help it 4%

This lecturer really means well but she habitually underestimates our intelligence. She actually felt it was necessary to define lattitude and longitude for us. Her lectures are highly disorganized which makes it difficult to study for her exams. This has the potential to be a really great class but she skims over important points for trivialities.

To be quite honest it was one of the worst classes I have taken at OSU. She was the type of teacher that after the midterm you would look to the person sitting next to you and say 'What? when did we ever learn about X?'. Pure and complete nonsense.
As the others said, boring class, so bring a book, or laptop, etc. because she takes attendance (or just have a buddy sign the sheet for you).

This class is a joke.  She takes attendence, though lectures are pointless.  Lots of grade padding (10 "cushion" points on the exams) and extra credit opportunities.  She gives you a lot of material to know for the exams, but just fill out the end of chapter questions on Carmen and you will do fine.

I think there is just far too much material for these exams.  There is a ton of material that is fair game to use on the exam and it can be overwhelming.  The homework definately helps boost your grade, but I think the weekly quizzes are just marginally helpful for the exams.

This class is awful.  The tests are pretty rediculious considering you basically dont really know what's going to be on them.  She doesnt give a study guide and just stands up in the middle of class and rambels on for two hours.  Take another 597 class....

This class is so boring. Her tests are ridiculous...you pretty much have to study EVERYTHING...lectures..hand outs...readings...videos...maps, EVERYTHING. She gives u the test format but not a study guide...so you really don't know what will show up. I hate her class. Don't take this is you are trying to fulfill a GEC!

This class is extremely boring and if it can be substituted for another class I would really recommend it.  Attendance probably isnt required if ur not going for an A but the amount of material on the exams is just ridiculous.  Its almost impossible to study that much material on one of the most boring subjects out there, good luck

Easy easy class, tons of extra credit and grade padding, if you can't get at least a B in this class, you either aren't going to class or aren't staying awake. Prof. Chabot is a really nice lady, and simplifies the concepts very well, although maybe a little too well. Either way, do the work and it's and easy A.
The class in itself is reallllly boring but there is tons of extra credit.  If you do all the homework questions and at least half listen to the lectures, a good grade is really easy to get.

shady with the attendence.  does not change grade when its boarder line when a student attendents to all her classes. i and never walked out in the middle of her lectures like others.  find another geog 597 prof.  i heard the other one is a nice person.  her tests are base off the book or lecture.   her avg class grade was c+

She made the class fun and the material easy to understand.  She also had a great sense of humor and was very knowledgeable.  As a bonus, she got me interested in Michael Palin's travel documentaries.

This prof is enthusiastic about the work she gives us but the work is hard to understand, the readings make no sense, her lectures leave all of us more confused. There is no clear structure to the class, as we were given 3 papers to write with less than a week's notice - without any clear guidelines or direction.

She is very vague and doesn't explain anything. The whole class is lost in what she's trying to get across. Expect homework, readings, pop quizzes, and talking in front of the class as well. The readings are hard to understand as well. Very hard to listen to. Mostly lecture classes.
Grades late with no help or reasoning for given grades.

Wasted my money on the textbook, wasted my time by going to class. Just go for map quizzes and to turn in papers. Having said that, she's extremely boring and simply reads the powerpoints word for word during lecture (posted on carmen) then shows some youtube clip she thinks is relevant. Easy A

I bought the book but wasted my money. The powerpoints are all that matter and are posted online. She just reads word for word off the powerpoint so it's really boring, but she's really nice and the class is super easy if you just attend the labs and do some basic studying before the tests.

Fairly simple class. Professor Barnes is a horrible instructor though. Very unprepared for class. Extremely dry and boring. Don't try to take notes by pen and paper...you better have a laptop so you can type because she goes too fast. Mid term and final are graded fairly i would say. I wouldn't recommend this class to anyone.

Lacked a bit of structure to the class and felt underprepared for the tests, however, the lab portion strongly made up for it. TA kind of made the class, but the class itself is really easy so I can't complain much. I enjoyed the subject material and conversations, though she was a bit hard to understand. Overall would take again.

Honestly a great professor all around. I took a class with a very few number of students and was initially scared about how the class would turn out. But honestly it could not have been better. The prof helped answer all questions and was available to students whenever needed while also being flexible. Highly recommend taking a class with her.

Yue puts a lot of energy into this class and although she is new to teaching, she is working hard to involve the students in discussion and create engaging lectures. To be fair, it is challenging to pay attention and participate, but there is not too much work outside of class. She is also very resourceful and great at answering questions.

Class was not structured. Instructor would hijack presentations on a near weekly basis (2 classes/wk). Class was monotonous, title was Topics in GIS but the only things we ever discussed was climate change and fossil fuels. Instructor would become visibly disgruntled if class wasnt already familiar with arbitrary acronyms or chemical processes.

No guidelines, grades, benchmarks, or general information usually ever (sometimes after serious probing and several different versions). Didn't handle students not understanding material (has laughed in faces) So much information and no idea how to structure it, connect topics, summarize, or otherwise make the information seem useful. DON'T TAKE!
